title: [$250] Flight details show incorrect negative layover time between legs of round trip

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Needs Reproduction
labels.description: Reproducible steps needed

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
## Problem When viewing flight details for a non-stop round-trip booking, sometimes the outbound flight displays an incorrect negative layover duration (e.g., "-10h -4m layover") before the flight departure time. This is confusing and also factually incorrect since the user doesn't even have a layover. ## Screenshot ## Steps to Reproduce The steps to repro are not clear. This is what the user did: 1. Booked a round-trip non-stop flight - Outbound: DEN→SFO departing Jan 25, 2026 at 10:08 AM - Return: SFO→DEN departing Jan 31, 2026 at 4:31 PM - Airline: United Airlines - Paid for using the Spotnana "Events" central card feature (probably not relevant) 2. Navigated to the trip details 3. View the outbound flight details **Expected:** No layover should be displayed between separate legs of a round trip **Actual:** Shows "-10h -4m layover" or similar negative duration However @blimpich wasn't able to reproduce this when they tried to book the same exact flight on staging. It might be a transient bug, but we should still be able to deduce what happened given the onyx data of the user. ## Impact Users see confusing and incorrect negative time durations on their flight details. ## Data [onyx-state (1).txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22890900/onyx-state.1.txt) trip room id: `7939124006765411` pnr id: `1516918334` @blimpich can also provide logs from the backend but this is a most likely a frontend issue so I haven't included them by default. ---
Theories & Investigation Notes ### Hypothesis on Root Cause The issue may have been introduced in **PR #67204** which added reservation sequencing logic. Potentially affected files: - `src/libs/TripReservationUtils.ts:490-504` (function `getReservationDetailsFromSequence`) - `src/pages/Travel/FlightTripDetails.tsx:42` (layover calculation) - `src/libs/DateUtils.ts:814-822` (function `getFormattedDurationBetweenDates`) ### Theory The `getReservationDetailsFromSequence()` function may be using `reservationIndex` to determine previous flights for layover calculations. However, `reservationIndex` tracks position within a single PNR, not chronological ordering across all trip segments. This could cause: 1. `prevReservation` to be `undefined` when a flight is first in its PNR but not first chronologically 2. Wrong reservation selection when flights from different legs are adjacent in sorted lists 3. The `intervalToDuration` function in date-fns returning negative values when dates are reversed ### Potential Fix Approach A proper fix might involve: 1. Checking that the previous reservation is a flight from the same `legId` AND same `reservationID` before showing layover 2. Adding validation in `getFormattedDurationBetweenDates()` to return `undefined` for invalid date ranges (start >= end) 3. Ensuring layovers only display between connecting flights within the same leg, not between separate legs of a multi-leg trip ### Data Analysis From Onyx export of affected trip (reportID: 7939124006765411, PNR: 1516918334): - Both flights are in the same PNR with `legIndex: 0` and `legIndex: 1` - Flights are correctly ordered chronologically in the `reportActionsPages` array - The negative duration suggests date comparison in wrong order or missing validation

  • Upwork Job ID: 1977806514334165303
  • Last Price Increase: 2025-10-13
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @dukenv0307

title: [$250] Reduce log requests

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Coming from slack [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C08CZDJFJ77/p1760108451520379) **Problem:** When every log entry is sent immediately after it’s created, it causes excessive network traffic and server load, which prevents the app from maintaining efficient performance and low resource usage. **Solution:** Batch log entries together and send them periodically or when thresholds are reached, reducing redundant network operations while preserving logging accuracy and reliability. **Batched logs (1st screenshot) Total time - 513ms** ``` Log Types: Info: 1,208 (100%) Warnings: 0 Errors: 0 Top Commands (API calls): OpenReport - 193 (15.98%) AuthenticatePusher - 55 (4.55%) PusherPing - 25 (2.07%) ReadNewestAction - 6 (0.50%) Log - 1 (0.08%) Top Components: Onyx - 309 (25.58%) - State management API - 152 (12.58%) - API calls SequentialQueue - 149 (12.33%) - Request queue OnyxUpdateManager - 129 (10.68%) - State updates OnyxDerived - 106 (8.77%) - Derived state PersistedRequests - 87 (7.20%) - Request persistence Network - 85 (7.04%) - Network operations Pusher - 54 (4.47%) - Real-time updates ``` **Non Batched logs (2nd screenshot): Total time for the chosen log - 433ms** ``` Log Types: Info: 40 (97.56%) Alert: 1 (2.44%) Top Commands (API calls): OpenReport - 6 (14.63%) AuthenticatePusher - 5 (12.20%) Log - 1 (2.44%) Top Components: OnyxUpdateManager - 12 (29.27%) - State updates Network - 6 (14.63%) - Network operations Onyx - 5 (12.20%) - State management Pusher - 3 (7.32%) - Real-time updates SequentialQueue - 3 (7.32%) - Request queue PusherAuthorizer - 2 (4.88%) - Auth API - 2 (4.88%) - API calls RequestThrottle - SequentialQueue - 2 (4.88%) - Throttling PersistedRequests - 2 (4.88%) - Request persistence BootSplash - 2 (4.88%) - Splash screen ``` Draft PR: [Expensify/App#71680](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71680)

title: [$250] Split - New card split during split edit is counted as out-of-pocket spend

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.29-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/63738 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+101001kh@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Log in with Expensifail account. - Workspace has card transactions. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Open the card transaction. 4. Click More > Split. 5. Click Add split. 6. Edit the amount of the splits so that it matches the total. 7. Click Save. → Out-of-pocket spend does not show up in Total section. 8. Open any split. 9. Click More > Edit splits. 10. Click Add split. 11. Edit the amount of the splits so that it matches the total. 12. Click Save. ## Expected Result: Out-of-pocket spend will not show up in Total section after creating a new split when editing splits. ## Actual Result: Out-of-pocket spend shows up in Total section after creating a new split when editing splits. The new split from Step 10 is counted as out-of-pocket spend. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f183ee50-fe73-476e-ad79-e3c392cb5a10 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

  • Upwork Job ID: 1977785052340644151

title: [Splits in NewDot] [$250] Expense - Card expense splits appear as cash expense when split offline

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.29-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1235/41237176/945414899?q=split&issue_type=jira **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+101001kh@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Workspace has card transactions. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Open the card transaction. 4. Go offline. 5. Click More > Split. 6. Click Save. 7. Open the split. → The split appears as cash instead of card expense when card transaction is split offline. Amount field shows Cash. Card field is missing. 8. Go online. → The split becomes card transaction after returning online. ## Expected Result: In Step 7, when card expense is split offline, the transaction thread of the split will show the same card details as the original card expense. ## Actual Result: In Step 7, when card expense is split offline, the transaction thread of the split does not show the same card details as the original card expense. Amount field shows Cash. Card field is missing. It shows Reimbursable toggle instead of Card field. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0278ac2f-5ad6-4171-85e0-5ffc624cb1d0 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
